name: The Bruiser of the Gods (Cleric 29 / Bard 1 / RDD 10)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Bruiser of the Gods 

Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/18/88/ec/1888 ... 8a1b9a.jpg

Simple build idea:
- Cleric 29 for 'undispellable' buffs, 3 epic bonus feats
- Bard 1/RDD 10 for ultra high strength, UMD, tumble dump, some RDD AC

The goals being:
- 40+ Str (the benchmark cleric/rdd build, Mithdradates's Blood and Faith reaches 36 Str)
- lvl 9 cleric spellbook
- enjoyable balance

Half-orc version has 42 str (54 capped), mundane AB 45. 71 AB hitting the AB cap + Str cap.
Human version has 42 str (54 capped), mundane AB 44, more skill points. 70 AB hitting the AB cap + Str cap. 

Domains I liked: 
- travel (haste), trickery (improved invisibility), strength (extra divine power/day, stoneskin), war (aura of vitality/cats grace), animal (empowered summons, cats grace, extra true seeing), plant (barkskin, creeping doom), healing (empowered healing, extra heal spells)
Spoiler

I chose heavy flail for 'bruiser' theme reasons, bludgeoning damage is great against certain enemies such as undead. 
Any weapon can work, martial weapons (ie scimitar, greatsword, halberd), exotic weapons (ie. bastard swords, scythes etc) by taking exotic instead of martial, or simple weapons (ie. morningstar, spear) for an extra pre-epic feat. With all that strength, a two handed weapon is very favorable, single handed and shield for extra AC is attractive.


Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/96/dc/17 ... ab4049.jpg

Dev crit can be incorporated by dropping toughness, blind fight, craft wand and two great strengths for power attack, cleave, great cleave, overwhelming critical, devastating critical for the human version, one extra feat to be dropped for improved critical for the half-orc version.
Dev crit version base Str is 40 (52 capped), mundane AB 44 (half-orc), 43 (human).
The half-orc version can have two higher strength however it loses epic prowess and a lot of skill points (ie out of tumble AC or concentration), the mundane AB is unchanged.
The human version has discipline but the half-orc version doesn't. A source of knockdown immunity will be mandatory for the human version up to level 30 and the half-orc version all levels. 
Even with max discipline I use knockdown immunity if I have it. No discipline makes one vulnerable to disarm attempts. 
20% exp penalty from lvl 30 onwards for the half-orc version. No penalties for humans.
Some delay with obtaining cleric spells to get the strength this high. Level 7 cleric spells at 23, level 8 spells at 26, level 9 cleric spells at 29. 
Scrolls could be used until then if you have access to them.
I believe there could be very nice synergy with the ultra-high strength and melee touch attack AB for harm (or heal against undead) spell attempts.

posts.author: blackfeltfedora
posts.content: I like the concept and I started playing the half-orc guy on Soulforge. Damage is solid but the low CON is killing me. Went with Strength domain for extra Divine Power and Trickery for Imp Invis. I've only gotten to 16 but it's tough going, hopefully things will get easier once I pick up Dev Crit.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hey blackfeltfedora
Thanks for your comments!
I myself have only playtested this to lvl 7 on WoG (like you I chose the half-orc because why not, have a warriors 45 AB on a cleric with a lvl 9 spell book), it is extremely powerful compared to other cleric builds I have playtested.
I am not familiar with Soulforge but the wiki seems to indicate it is a pretty awesome place, a PW running for over a decade, going to lvl 40!  excellent choice to play test this as it gains 5 strength at level 40! Even says the players + characters who are on. Is Vurg the Tainted this build? Cool name!
RE the low CON it is something to manage for sure. 

Things I found helpful:
Fighting enemies one by one by pulling them with a ranged weapon.
Using summons to help with tank for you, which you can do from the beginning. If you are worried about dying in a single crit hit then equip a ranged weapon until your HP is higher. 
Entropic shield is handy against ranged attacks before you get improved invisibility.
Clerics have the endurance spell, which can boost HP up.
Single handed weapon and shield early pre-epic levels (ie before lvl 12), the extra AC just helps, clerics can buff the tower shield up to a +5 tower shield. (Part of the reason why I put the weapon focus feat a little later the other reason clerics also have lots of ways to boost AB)
Once you get a lot of strength and HP I think two handed will be better in 1v1 situations or against spellcasters due to the +1.5x strength modifier damage. Switch to shield and one handed when one has to tank or deal with mobs. 
There are great spell strategies too.
Darkness / Ultravision with melee mobs without ultravision. With improved invisibility: attack miss chance 50%, 50% concealment, plus you get AB bonuses against them, the AI can't detect you so well helping with the 1v1 strategy. 
Hammer of the gods is a great party friendly AoE ability against low will save opponents who are not mind immune.
Word of Faith, blinding mobs for a decent duration with no save (when you get it), is another outstanding strategy.

The Dev crit is not essential at all, in fact probably weakens the build with all the pre-requisite feats in my opinion, blind fight, toughness, etc are all very important feats. I think you're going to be killing them without it, but its there as an option because some players will want dev crit with all that strength and huge AB boosts from cleric but I think dev crit actually makes it harder :)

Hope all this helps!

posts.author: blackfeltfedora
posts.content:
Yep that was me, was able to tag along in a good party to 20 which always helps. SF modified Dev Crit, not as good as an instant kill but the KD/Haste combo is a nice bonus (no perma-haste items on the server). Once I get STR to 25 and WIS to 19 I'm going to throw a point in CON. I think getting all those RDD goodies late in the build will keep things interesting.
A dev crit knocks the target down for 9 seconds (1.5 rounds) if \it is not immune to knock down, deals extra physical damage of the type the weapon does, and gives the attacker haste for 5 rounds.
The extra damage is critical multiplier x 33, the WM feat is taken into account. The haste effect will not replace haste spells from other sources.
